# Functie om reviews te berekenen voor een specifieke stad
calculate_reviews_for_city <- function(dataset, city_name, top_n = 100, bottom_n = 100) {
  # Filter data voor de opgegeven stad
  city_data <- subset(dataset, room_type == "Private room")
  
  # Sorteer de dataset op prijs in oplopende volgorde
  sorted_listings <- city_data[order(city_data$price), ]
  
  # Selecteer de top 100 en bottom 100 listings
  bottom_100 <- sorted_listings[1:bottom_n, ]
  top_100 <- sorted_listings[(nrow(sorted_listings) - (top_n - 1)):nrow(sorted_listings), ]
  
  # Bereken het totale aantal reviews voor elk subset
  total_reviews_top <- sum(top_100$number_of_reviews)
  total_reviews_bottom <- sum(bottom_100$number_of_reviews)
  
  # Vergelijk het totale aantal reviews en geef resultaat weer met getallen
  if (total_reviews_top > total_reviews_bottom) {
    cat(paste("Top", top_n, "single room listings in", city_name, "have more reviews (", total_reviews_top, ") than bottom", bottom_n, "single room listings (", total_reviews_bottom, ").\n"))
  } else if (total_reviews_top < total_reviews_bottom) {
    cat(paste("Bottom", bottom_n, "single room listings in", city_name, "have more reviews (", total_reviews_bottom, ") than top", top_n, "single room listings (", total_reviews_top, ").\n"))
  } else {
    cat(paste("Top", top_n, "and bottom", bottom_n, "single room listings in", city_name, "have the same number of reviews (", total_reviews_top, ").\n"))
  }
}

# Voorbeeldgebruik:

# Define a function to analyze Airbnb data from multiple URLs
analyze_airbnb_data <- function(url_list) {
  # Initialize empty lists to store results
  total_reviews_top_list <- vector("numeric", length(url_list))
  total_reviews_bottom_list <- vector("numeric", length(url_list))
  
  for (i in seq_along(url_list)) {
    url <- url_list[i]
    
    # Read the CSV data from the URL and store it in a data frame
    my_dataset <- read.csv(url)
    
    # Filter data for single rooms in Amsterdam
    amsterdam_single_rooms <- subset(my_dataset, room_type == "Private room")
    
    # Sort by price in ascending order
    sorted_listings <- amsterdam_single_rooms[order(amsterdam_single_rooms$price), ]
    
    # Select the top 100 and bottom 100 listings
    bottom_100 <- sorted_listings[1:100, ]
    top_100 <- sorted_listings[(nrow(sorted_listings) - 99):nrow(sorted_listings), ]
    
    # Calculate the total number of reviews for each subset
    total_reviews_top <- sum(top_100$number_of_reviews)
    total_reviews_bottom <- sum(bottom_100$number_of_reviews)
    
    # Store the results in the corresponding lists
    total_reviews_top_list[i] <- total_reviews_top
    total_reviews_bottom_list[i] <- total_reviews_bottom
    
    # Print the results for each URL
    cat("Results for URL", i, "— Total reviews for the top 100 listings:", total_reviews_top, "\n")
    cat("Results for URL", i, "— Total reviews for the bottom 100 listings:", total_reviews_bottom, "\n")
  }
  
  # Return a list of results
  results <- list(
    total_reviews_top = total_reviews_top_list,
    total_reviews_bottom = total_reviews_bottom_list
  )
  
  return(results)
}

# Define a function to analyze Airbnb data from named URLs
analyze_airbnb_data <- function(url_map) {
  # Initialize empty lists to store results
  total_reviews_top_list <- vector("numeric", length(url_map))
  total_reviews_bottom_list <- vector("numeric", length(url_map))
  
  for (i in seq_along(url_map)) {
    url_name <- names(url_map)[i]
    url <- url_map[[url_name]]
    
    # Read the CSV data from the URL and store it in a data frame
    my_dataset <- read.csv(url)
    
    # Filter data for single rooms in Amsterdam
    amsterdam_single_rooms <- subset(my_dataset, room_type == "Private room")
    
    # Sort by price in ascending order
    sorted_listings <- amsterdam_single_rooms[order(amsterdam_single_rooms$price), ]
    
    # Select the top 100 and bottom 100 listings
    bottom_100 <- sorted_listings[1:100, ]
    top_100 <- sorted_listings[(nrow(sorted_listings) - 99):nrow(sorted_listings), ]
    
    # Calculate the total number of reviews for each subset
    total_reviews_top <- sum(top_100$number_of_reviews)
    total_reviews_bottom <- sum(bottom_100$number_of_reviews)
    
    # Store the results in the corresponding lists
    total_reviews_top_list[i] <- total_reviews_top
    total_reviews_bottom_list[i] <- total_reviews_bottom
    
    # Print the results for each URL with its name
    cat("Results for", url_name, "- Total reviews for the top 100 listings:", total_reviews_top, "\n")
    cat("Results for", url_name, "- Total reviews for the bottom 100 listings:", total_reviews_bottom, "\n")
  }
  
  # Return a list of results
  results <- list(
    total_reviews_top = total_reviews_top_list,
    total_reviews_bottom = total_reviews_bottom_list
  )
  
  return(results)
}

)

# Call the function to analyze the Airbnb data from named URLs
